Estimated probability: **40%**.

(c) **Donald Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024**: Legal proceedings, especially those involving high-profile individuals like former President Donald Trump, are subject to extensive investigations, legal deliberations, and potential delays. As of the knowledge cutoff in October 2023, while investigations are ongoing, predicting specific charges within a set timeframe is highly uncertain. Estimated probability: **20%**.

Since all three events must occur for the overall resolution to be **Yes**, we multiply their probabilities:

0.70 (a) * 0.40 (b) * 0.20 (c) = **0.056**

question.title: Will the Silver Close above $30.50 @4pm on August 9th, 2024. (According to Kitco.com trading price @ 4pm EST.)
question.body:
This market will resolve yes if the price of 1 ounce of silver is above $30.50 (USD) at exactly 4pm Easter standard time on August 9th 2024. The price of 1 ounce of silver will be determined by the live ticker price per ounce listed on Kitco.com. Should the price be exactly 30.50 USD per ounce of silver at 4pm on August 9th the market will resolve as no. The question is particularly specific to the point ABOVE $30.50USD. 

Should the price be at 30.50 USD or below 30.50 USD the market will resolve as a NO. 

I will do my best to resolve this market on time, if it hasn’t been resolved by 5pm EST time on August 9th 2024, please comment and remind me to resolve the marketplace! 

Thank you

metadata.chain_of_thought: Predicting the exact price of silver nearly a year in advance involves a significant degree of uncertainty due to the myriad factors that can influence commodity prices. As of October 2023, silver has been experiencing volatility, influenced by factors such as global economic conditions, inflation rates, interest rate policies, geopolitical events, and changes in investor sentiment. Historically, silver prices have fluctuated between $20 and $30 per ounce, with periods of both appreciation and depreciation. Achieving a price above $30.50 USD by August 9th, 2024, would likely require favorable economic conditions, increased industrial demand, or other bullish factors that may not sustain over such a period. Additionally, external shocks or unfavorable economic developments could impede reaching this price point.

question.title: Given the Silver closes above $30.50 on August 9th, 2024, will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The price of 1 ounce of silver closes above $30.50 (USD) at exactly 4pm Eastern Standard Time on August 9th, 2024, as determined by the live ticker price per ounce listed on Kitco.com. Then, is it true that the Greens–EFA political group will hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections?

Resolution criteria for the condition P: The price of silver must be above $30.50 USD at 4pm EST on August 9th, 2024, according to Kitco.com. If the price is exactly $30.50 or below, the condition is not met.

Resolution criteria for the outcome Q: The Greens–EFA political group must hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions resolve as Yes.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The correlation between the price of silver closing above $30.50 on August 9th, 2024, and the Greens–EFA holding the most seats in the European Parliament is unclear and likely weak. The performance of a specific commodity like silver typically does not have a direct or significant impact on the distribution of seats among political groups in elections. Additionally, historical data indicates that the Greens–EFA have not been the dominant group in the European Parliament. Major political groups such as the European People's Party (EPP) and the Socialists and Democrats (S&D) have consistently held more seats. While economic factors can influence voter behavior, a single commodity price point is insufficient to determine electoral outcomes. Therefore, it is unlikely that the Greens–EFA will hold the most seats based solely on the specified silver price condition.

question.title: Conditional on both of the following occurring: (a) Silver closes above $30.50 on August 9th, 2024, and (b) Greens–EFA holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 
(a) The price of 1 ounce of silver is above $30.50 (USD) at exactly 4pm Eastern Standard Time on August 9th, 2024, as determined by Kitco.com. The price must be strictly above $30.50 USD.
(b) The Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, as determined by official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports. In the case of a tie, this condition is also satisfied.

Then, will the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, according to the data from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL using the exact (not rounded) value?

metadata.chain_of_thought: The condition (a) indicates that silver prices are relatively high, which can be a sign of increased commodity costs. Higher commodity prices often contribute to inflationary pressures, as businesses may pass these costs onto consumers, potentially leading to an increase in the Core CPI. Additionally, condition (b) specifies that the Greens–EFA holds the most seats in the European Parliament. While European political outcomes may have indirect effects on the global economy, including trade policies and environmental regulations, their direct impact on the US Core CPI is less pronounced. However, if European policies lead to global supply chain disruptions or increased costs for imported goods, this could further contribute to inflationary pressures in the US. Considering both conditions, the combined effect leans towards a higher likelihood of the Core CPI increasing by more than 0.1% in July 2024.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Will the Silver Close above $30.50 @4pm on August 9th, 2024. (According to Kitco.com trading price @ 4pm EST.) (b) Will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections? (c) Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
(a) This market will resolve yes if the price of 1 ounce of silver is above $30.50 (USD) at exactly 4pm Easter standard time on August 9th 2024. The price of 1 ounce of silver will be determined by the live ticker price per ounce listed on Kitco.com. Should the price be exactly 30.50 USD per ounce of silver at 4pm on August 9th the market will resolve as no. The question is particularly specific to the point ABOVE $30.50USD.

Should the price be at 30.50 USD or below 30.50 USD the market will resolve as a NO.

I will do my best to resolve this market on time, if it hasn’t been resolved by 5pm EST time on August 9th 2024, please comment and remind me to resolve the marketplace!

Thank you

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

(c) Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024.

The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
To estimate the probability that all three events (a, b, and c) will resolve as 'Yes,' we need to assess each event individually and consider any potential interdependencies.

**(a) Silver Closing Above $30.50 on August 9th, 2024 at 4pm EST:**
As of October 2023, the price of silver has been subject to volatility influenced by factors such as inflation rates, US dollar strength, geopolitical tensions, and investor sentiment towards precious metals as a hedge. Historically, silver prices have fluctuated, but predicting the exact price on a specific future date is inherently uncertain. Given the target of $30.50, which is on the higher end based on recent trends, there's a moderate likelihood that silver could surpass this threshold, especially if inflationary pressures persist or if there's increased demand for industrial uses of silver.

**(b) Greens–EFA Holding the Most Seats in the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections:**
The Greens–European Free Alliance (EFA) has been gaining traction in various European countries due to increasing public concern over climate change and environmental policies. However, the European Parliament consists of multiple political groups, and securing the most seats would require a significant and widespread shift in voter preferences across diverse member states. While the Greens–EFA are on an upward trajectory, historically, larger groups like the European People's Party (EPP) or the Progressive Alliance of Socialists and Democrats (S&D) have held the most seats. Therefore, it's somewhat unlikely, though not impossible, that the Greens–EFA will emerge as the largest group.

**(c) US Core CPI Increasing by More Than 0.1% Month-over-Month in July 2024:**
Core CPI, which excludes volatile food and energy prices, provides insight into underlying inflation trends. As of late 2023, the US has been experiencing a gradual cooling in inflation rates, aided by the Federal Reserve's monetary policies. A month-over-month increase of more than 0.1% would indicate persistent inflationary pressures. Given the Federal Reserve's efforts to stabilize inflation around the 2% target and assuming no unforeseen economic shocks, it's plausible that the Core CPI could edge above 0.1% in a given month, but it's also possible that it remains steady or increases by a marginal amount less than 0.1%.

Considering these assessments:
- **Event (a):** Moderate probability (~0.5)
- **Event (b):** Lower probability (~0.2)
- **Event (c):** Moderate probability (~0.5)

Assuming relative independence among these events, the combined probability of all three occurring is the product of their individual probabilities.

Probability: 0.5 * 0.2 * 0.5 = 0.05

question.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
question.body: This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of October 2023, Joe Biden is serving as the President of the United States, having taken office on January 20, 2021. The next scheduled presidential election is set for November 2024, with the inauguration of the new president occurring in January 2025. Given this timeline, there are no immediate indications of Joe Biden leaving office before the end of his term. Unless an unforeseen event such as resignation, impeachment, or incapacitation occurs, it is highly likely that Joe Biden will still be the sitting president by the end of July 2024.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden still being president by the end of July, will Meta publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. 

Then, will Meta publish a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if, by June 30, 2024, Meta publishes a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models. Resolves NO otherwise. If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of October 2023, Meta has been actively engaged in improving the safety and transparency of its AI models. Publishing reports from external red-teaming exercises aligns with industry trends towards greater accountability and collaboration with independent researchers. However, the timeline for such publications can be influenced by various factors, including the completion of red-teaming processes, internal review procedures, and strategic communication planning. Given that the deadline is June 30, 2024, and assuming that Joe Biden remains president by the end of July 2024, it is plausible that Meta could release such a report within this timeframe. Nonetheless, without specific commitments from Meta, there remains uncertainty regarding their ability to meet this deadline.

question.title: Given Joe Biden is still president by July 31, 2024, and Meta publishes a safety report by June 30, 2024, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 

1. At 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.
2. By June 30, 2024, Meta publishes a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

Given these conditions, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 1, 2024, any of the following occurs according to official statements or credible reports:
- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of October 2023, the diplomatic relationship between the Philippines and China has been characterized by both cooperation and tension, particularly concerning territorial disputes in the South China Sea. While there have been incidents and disagreements, there has been no significant escalation that would typically lead to diplomatic expulsions or recalls. Diplomatic actions of this magnitude usually result from severe conflicts, breaches of international agreements, or significant geopolitical shifts. Given that Joe Biden remains president until July 31, 2024, and Meta's publication of a safety report by June 30, 2024, does not directly influence the Philippines-China diplomatic relations, there are no immediate indicators suggesting that such expulsions or recalls are likely to occur before June 1, 2024. Therefore, the probability of diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China occurring before June 1, 2024, remains low based on the current information.

question.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July 2024, will Meta publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, and will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **YES** if all of the following conditions are met: (a) At 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024, Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States. (b) By June 30, 2024, Meta publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models. (c) Before June 1, 2024, one of the following events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If any of these conditions are not met, then this resolves as **No**.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
To determine the probability that all three conditions resolve as **YES**, we need to evaluate each component separately and then consider their combined likelihood.

1. **Joe Biden's Presidency by End of July 2024**: As of the knowledge cutoff in October 2023, Joe Biden is the incumbent President of the United States, having been inaugurated in January 2021. The next presidential election is scheduled for November 2024, with the inauguration of the successor expected in January 2025. Unless unforeseen events such as resignation, impeachment, or health issues arise, it is highly probable that Biden will remain president until the end of July 2024. Historical stability of U.S. presidencies supports this assessment.

2. **Meta Publishing an External Red-Teaming Report by June 30, 2024**: Meta has been actively involved in AI development and has shown interest in AI safety and transparency. External red-teaming, which involves third-party assessments to identify potential vulnerabilities in AI models, aligns with industry trends toward greater accountability. However, the commitment to publish such a report by the specified date depends on Meta's internal priorities, resource allocation, and possible external factors. While there is a reasonable expectation given current industry standards, uncertainties remain regarding the exact timeline and execution.

3. **Diplomatic Expulsions or Recalls Between the Philippines and China Before June 1, 2024**: The relationship between the Philippines and China has been tense, primarily due to disputes over the South China Sea. Diplomatic expulsions or recalls are significant actions that typically arise from heightened conflicts or escalations. While there are underlying tensions, such severe diplomatic maneuvers depend on future geopolitical developments, negotiations, and the actions of both nations. Given the complexity of international relations, predicting such events carries inherent uncertainty.

Considering the individual probabilities:
- **Biden remains president**: High probability (≈0.95)
- **Meta publishes the report**: Moderate probability (≈0.6)
- **Diplomatic expulsions/recalls occur**: Lower probability (≈0.3)

Assuming independence between these events, the combined probability is:
0.95 * 0.6 * 0.3 ≈ 0.171

question.title: Will Georgia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other outcome, the question will resolve as **No**.

metadata.chain_of_thought: Reasoning: Georgia has been a participant in the Eurovision Song Contest since 2007, consistently sending entries to compete in the competition. Over the years, Georgia has had a mixed record in terms of qualifying for the Grand Final. They have successfully reached the final multiple times, achieving respectable placements, including a top-ten finish in 2010. However, there have also been years where Georgia failed to qualify from the semi-finals. The qualification process is influenced by various factors such as the song's appeal, performance quality, staging, and voting dynamics, which can be unpredictable. Assuming that Georgia continues with a similar approach to their selection and performance strategy as in previous years, and without any significant changes to the competition format or voting system, it is reasonable to estimate a moderate probability of them qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024.

question.title: Given Georgia qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Czechia also qualify?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Czechia also qualify for the Grand Final? This resolves as **Yes** if Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Czechia does not qualify, it resolves as **No**. If Georgia does not qualify, this question resolves as N/A.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The qualification of Georgia for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final does not directly influence Czechia's chances of qualifying. Each country's qualification is determined independently based on their performance in their respective semi-finals and the overall voting results. Historically, Georgia has had a relatively strong track record, frequently qualifying for the Grand Final. Czechia, on the other hand, has had more variability in their qualifications, with a success rate of around 50% in recent years. Given that Georgia has qualified, this information does not provide specific insights into Czechia's performance. Therefore, based on historical data and the independent nature of each country's qualification, the probability of Czechia also qualifying remains moderate.

question.title: Given both Georgia and Czechia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will the Netherlands also qualify?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both Georgia and Czechia qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. This means that both Georgia and Czechia have participated in a Semi-final and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Grand Final.

Then, is it true that the Netherlands will also qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final? This will resolve as **Yes** if the Netherlands participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Grand Final. If the Netherlands does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The qualification of Georgia and Czechia for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final primarily indicates that these countries performed well enough in their respective semi-finals to secure a spot in the final. Eurovision qualifications are based on a combination of jury and public votes, and while the success of certain countries can influence voting patterns to some extent, the qualification of Georgia and Czechia does not directly impact the Netherlands' chances. The Netherlands has a strong track record in Eurovision, including recent victories and consistent qualifications, which suggests a high likelihood of their qualification independent of other countries' outcomes. Additionally, the number of available spots in the Grand Final is typically sufficient to accommodate multiple strong contenders, reducing the likelihood that the qualification of Georgia and Czechia would negatively affect the Netherlands' chances.

question.title: Will Georgia, Czechia, and the Netherlands all qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following occur: (a) Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, (b) Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (c) the Netherlands participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If any of Georgia, Czechia, or the Netherlands does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

metadata.chain_of_thought: Assessing the likelihood of Georgia, Czechia, and the Netherlands all qualifying for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final involves examining each country's historical performance and current trends up to October 2023. The Netherlands has consistently been a strong contender in recent years, including a win in 2019 and high placements thereafter, which suggests a high probability of qualification. Czechia has shown improvement since their return to Eurovision in 2015, with more consistent qualifications in recent editions, indicating a moderate to high chance of advancing. Georgia has had mixed results in past competitions, with several qualifications but also instances where they did not make it to the final. Given these factors, while the Netherlands and Czechia appear likely to qualify based on their recent performances, Georgia's uncertain track record introduces some risk. Therefore, the combined probability of all three countries qualifying is moderately favorable but not certain.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

metadata.chain_of_thought: Kamala Harris is currently serving as the Democratic Vice President alongside President Joe Biden. If President Biden decides to run for a second term, it is likely that the Democratic Party would retain the incumbent Vice President to maintain continuity and leverage her experience in the administration. However, factors such as Harris seeking higher office, shifts in party strategy, or unforeseen political developments could influence the decision to nominate a different Vice Presidential candidate. Given these considerations, there is a moderate probability that Kamala Harris will continue as the Democratic Vice President.

question.title: GIVEN Kamala Harris is the Democratic VP, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. Then, is Donald Trump removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?

Resolution Criteria for the Condition (P):
- Kamala Harris needs to be nominated as the Democratic VP. If someone else is selected as VP, the condition is not met. The condition can be resolved immediately after the nomination.

Resolution Criteria for the Outcome (Q):
- The question resolves as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.
- This must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports.
- The question resolves as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. The resolution does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
To assess the probability that Donald Trump will be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, several factors need to be considered:

1. **Legal Framework of Section 3, 14th Amendment**: This section prohibits individuals who have engaged in insurrection or rebellion against the United States, or given aid to its enemies, from holding federal or state office. Applying this to a living individual, especially a former president, involves complex legal interpretations and unprecedented political actions.

2. **Current Legal Proceedings and Investigations**: As of October 2023, there have been discussions and investigations regarding Trump's actions, including the events surrounding January 6, 2021. However, concrete legal actions specifically invoking Section 3 to disqualify him from running have not been successfully executed or widely supported in courts.

3. **Political Climate and Support**: Removing a major political figure like Trump from the ballot would require significant bipartisan support, which is currently unlikely given his substantial base of support within the Republican Party. Additionally, such an action could be perceived as politically motivated, leading to further polarization.

4. **State-Level Actions**: Even if there is momentum at the federal level, individual states would need to act in concert to remove Trump from ballots. This requires state legislatures or courts to take definitive action based on legal interpretations of Section 3, which may be hindered by political resistance or differing state laws.

5. **Judicial Process and Timelines**: Legal challenges invoking Section 3 would undergo extensive judicial review, potentially reaching higher courts, including the Supreme Court. The time required for these processes makes it highly improbable to achieve a final decision by July 15, 2024.

6. **Precedent and Historical Context**: There is little to no precedent for disqualifying a major candidate through this constitutional provision, making it an untested and risky legal strategy with uncertain outcomes.

Considering these factors, while not entirely impossible, the combination of legal complexities, political resistance, and time constraints makes the likelihood of Trump being removed or blocked from any primary election ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by the specified date very low.

question.title: Given Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP and Donald Trump is blocked from the primary ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: (a) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, meaning she is the initial nominee for the Vice President position by the Democratic party, and (b) Donald Trump is officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. This means that on July 15, 2024, official announcements, court decisions, or credible media reports confirm his removal or blockage, and speculative reports do not count. Given these conditions, will Donald Trump be charged or indicted with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024? This resolves as **Yes** if Trump is charged for any statements related to potential witnesses in the case *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before the specified date.

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of October 2023, there have been ongoing investigations involving Donald Trump, including matters related to his activities in Georgia. However, indictments, especially for charges as serious as witness tampering, require substantial evidence and typically follow lengthy legal processes. Given the hypothetical conditions that Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP and Trump is blocked from the primary ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024, these political developments could influence legal proceedings but do not directly necessitate an indictment. Additionally, the timeframe until June 1, 2024, is relatively short for such a significant legal action to be completed. Considering these factors, it is unlikely that Trump will be charged or indicted with witness tampering in Georgia before the specified date.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Kamala Harris be nominated as the Democratic VP, (b) Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, and (c) Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this part resolves to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this part resolves to no. The VP nomination is considered based on the initial nomination and will not change if the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination.

(b) Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. This part resolves as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been removed or blocked based on official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports or unofficial announcements will not suffice. The resolution strictly pertains to the status as of July 15, 2024, and does not account for subsequent legal changes after this date.

(c) Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

For the combined question to resolve as "Yes," all three conditions (a), (b), and (c) must occur as described.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
To determine the probability that all three conditions (a), (b), and (c) are met, we need to assess each component individually:

(a) **Kamala Harris being nominated as the Democratic VP:** As the current Vice President, Kamala Harris is a strong contender for renomination. If she seeks re-election and her party supports her candidacy, this outcome is highly probable.

(b) **Donald Trump being removed or blocked from the primary election ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment:** Section 3 pertains to disqualifying individuals who have engaged in insurrection or rebellion against the United States. As of October 2023, there have been no successful legal actions or credible indications that Donald Trump will be removed or blocked from the ballot under this provision. Such an outcome would require significant legal and political developments, making it unlikely in the near term.

(c) **Donald Trump being charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024:** There is no public evidence or credible reports suggesting that Trump will face such charges within this timeframe. Legal proceedings of this nature typically involve extensive investigations and processes, making this outcome improbable within the specified period.

Since all three conditions must occur for the combined question to resolve as "Yes," and considering the low likelihood of both conditions (b) and (c) being fulfilled, the overall probability is very low.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of my knowledge cutoff in October 2023, President Joe Biden has not shown any indications of withdrawing from the 2024 presidential race. Historically, incumbent presidents who seek re-election tend to remain in the race unless faced with significant health issues or insurmountable political challenges. There have been no major reports or credible sources suggesting that Biden plans to drop out before July 20, 2024. Additionally, dropping out so close to the election would likely have significant political repercussions, making it an unlikely scenario without substantial cause.

question.title: Conditional on Biden dropping out before July 20, will Linda Yaccarino be the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Then, will Linda Yaccarino be the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this condition is met.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Linda Yaccarino is in the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, according to official announcements from Twitter or credible media sources. Resolves NO otherwise.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The position of CEO at Twitter, held by Linda Yaccarino as of my knowledge cutoff in October 2023, is generally determined by the company's board of directors and not directly influenced by political events such as the actions of a U.S. presidential candidate. If President Biden were to drop out before July 20, 2024, it is unlikely to have a direct impact on Yaccarino's role at Twitter. Unless there are specific contractual, political, or business ties between Yaccarino and Biden that are publicly known, her position would remain stable irrespective of Biden's participation in the race. Therefore, the probability that Linda Yaccarino will still be the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024, conditional on Biden dropping out before July 20, is high.

question.title: Conditional on both Biden dropping out before July 20 and Linda Yaccarino being CEO of Twitter on July 1, will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: (a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, and (b) Linda Yaccarino is in the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, according to official announcements from Twitter or credible media sources. Then, will the US Core CPI for July 2024, seasonally adjusted, increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024? The data for resolution will be taken from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The US Core CPI measures the average change in prices for goods and services, excluding volatile food and energy sectors. Political changes, such as President Biden dropping out before July 20, and corporate leadership changes at Twitter with Linda Yaccarino becoming CEO on July 1, are unlikely to have a direct and immediate impact on the Core CPI. The Core CPI is more influenced by factors like monetary policy, supply chain dynamics, consumer demand, and global economic conditions. Given these conditions, while minor fluctuations in CPI are normal, a month-over-month increase of more than 0.1% is plausible based on typical inflation trends, independent of the specified political and corporate events.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20, (b) Linda Yaccarino is the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024, and (c) the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body: (a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. (b) Linda Yaccarino is in the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, according to official announcements from Twitter or credible media sources. (c) The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
(a) Biden drops out before July 20, 2024: As of October 2023, there are no significant indications or events suggesting that President Joe Biden intends to withdraw from the 2024 presidential race. Incumbent presidents typically remain in the race unless unforeseen circumstances arise. Considering his age and current political standing, it is unlikely he would drop out voluntarily at this stage.
(b) Linda Yaccarino is the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024: Although Linda Yaccarino was appointed as the Chairwoman of Twitter, the company's leadership has been notably fluid under Elon Musk's ownership. Given the dynamic nature of Twitter's management and Musk's propensity for making swift organizational changes, there is considerable uncertainty about whether Yaccarino will retain her CEO position by July 2024.
(c) The Month-over-Month US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July 2024: The Core CPI measures inflation by excluding volatile food and energy prices. Historically, a monthly increase of over 0.1% is modest and aligns with past trends. Economic factors such as Federal Reserve policies, supply chain dynamics, and consumer spending will influence this outcome. While exact predictions are challenging, current indicators suggest a stable but slightly increasing inflation rate.

Assuming these events are independent, the combined probability is the product of their individual probabilities. 
- Probability of (a): ~10%  
- Probability of (b): ~40%  
- Probability of (c): ~70%  
Thus, the probability that all three events occur is 0.1 * 0.4 * 0.7 = 0.028

question.title: Will Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of October 2023, Liz Cheney remains a prominent Republican figure known for her outspoken criticism of former President Donald Trump. Her stance has created significant tension within the GOP, leading to reduced support from key party factions and endorsements often favoring pro-Trump candidates. The Republican National Convention tends to reflect the preferences of its delegates, who have largely aligned with candidates that support Trump's policies and leadership style. Additionally, there has been no notable surge in support for Cheney that would indicate a shift in the party's nomination trajectory. Given these dynamics, it is unlikely that Liz Cheney will secure the Republican nomination for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

question.title: Given Liz Cheney is the Republican nominee, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Then, is it true that Joe Biden will announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive. If such a statement is not made, it resolves as No.

metadata.chain_of_thought: As the incumbent President, Joe Biden has not yet publicly committed to running for re-election in 2024. Historically, incumbent presidents often seek re-election unless there are significant personal or political reasons to withdraw. Given that Liz Cheney is the Republican nominee, it does not directly influence Biden's decision to run or not. Additionally, as of the knowledge cutoff in October 2023, there has been no substantial indication from Biden or his campaign suggesting an early withdrawal from the race. Therefore, it is unlikely that Biden will make a definitive public announcement by July 15, 2024, declaring he will not seek or accept the Democratic nomination.

question.title: If both Liz Cheney is the Republican nominee and Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Joe Biden makes a definitive, public, official announcement before July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic nomination for President. Then, will Kamala Harris's Electoral College probability in Nate Silver's model be greater than 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM?

Resolution criteria:
- For (a): Resolves YES if Liz Cheney is selected as the Republican nominee.
- For (b): Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination before July 15, 2024.
- For the outcome: Resolves YES if Kamala Harris's Electoral College probability is >46.6% on the specified date and time in Nate Silver's model. Resolves NO otherwise.

metadata.chain_of_thought: If Liz Cheney becomes the Republican nominee and Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination, the dynamics of the 2024 US Presidential Election would shift significantly. Kamala Harris, as a prominent Democratic figure and the current Vice President, might position herself as a strong candidate for the Democratic nomination in the absence of Biden's candidacy. According to Nate Silver's model, such a scenario could enhance her Electoral College probability due to her political experience, national recognition, and potential voter support. However, this estimate would also depend on factors like campaign effectiveness, policy positions, primary challenges, and the Republican opponent's strength. Considering these variables, it's reasonable to project that Kamala Harris's Electoral College probability could exceed the 46.6% threshold under the given conditions.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President (c) Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
(a) Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President: This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

(c) Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model: Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

metadata.chain_of_thought: The probability that all three events occur is exceedingly low due to the individual improbabilities associated with each event. (a) Liz Cheney as the Republican nominee: As of the latest political developments up to October 2023, Liz Cheney has faced significant challenges within the Republican Party, primarily due to her criticisms of former President Donald Trump. The party's current trajectory and Cheney's standing make her nomination highly unlikely. (b) Joe Biden announcing he won't accept the Democratic nomination by July 15, 2024: President Biden has not indicated any intentions of stepping down or declining the nomination. Given his role as the incumbent president and the typical behavior of sitting presidents seeking re-election, such an announcement would be unprecedented and highly improbable. (c) Kamala Harris's odds increasing according to Nate Silver's model: Nate Silver's models are based on polling data and trends. For Kamala Harris's odds to increase over a one-week period would require significant shifts in public opinion or unforeseen political developments, which are not anticipated in the current context. Considering that each of these events is individually unlikely, the combined probability of all three occurring is extremely low.

question.title: Will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

metadata.chain_of_thought: Will Hurd, a former U.S. Congressman from Texas, has not publicly announced any intention to run for the Republican nomination in the 2024 U.S. Presidential Election. The current Republican field is dominated by high-profile candidates such as former President Donald Trump and Governor Ron DeSantis, who have significant support within the party. Additionally, Will Hurd is known for his moderate positions, which may not align with the prevailing sentiments of the Republican base seeking more conservative or populist candidates. Without an official campaign launch and given the strong presence of established contenders, it is unlikely that Will Hurd will secure the Republican nomination.

question.title: If Will Hurd is the Republican nominee, will Vivek Ramaswamy also be the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, is Vivek Ramaswamy also selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criteria for the condition: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**.

metadata.chain_of_thought: In the Republican nomination process for the US Presidential Election, only one candidate can be selected as the nominee. If Will Hurd is chosen as the Republican nominee, it inherently means that no other candidate, including Vivek Ramaswamy, can also hold the nominee position simultaneously. The nomination process does not allow for multiple nominees from the same party in a single election cycle.

question.title: Given both Will Hurd and Vivek Ramaswamy are selected as Republican nominees, will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both Will Hurd and Vivek Ramaswamy are selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This scenario is highly unlikely as typically only one candidate is selected as the nominee. The resolution criterion for this condition is that both individuals must be selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Then, is the following true? The Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election. This resolves as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

metadata.chain_of_thought: Ohio's 6th congressional district has consistently leaned Republican and has been held by Republican representatives for an extended period. Given this strong partisan inclination, the Republican Party typically has a significant advantage in retaining the seat during elections. In the context of the 2024 special election, assuming that both Will Hurd and Vivek Ramaswamy are selected as Republican nominees—a scenario that is highly improbable—the party's foundational support in the district remains robust. Additionally, special elections can have lower voter turnout, which often favors the incumbent party. While the presence of two prominent Republican figures might introduce some dynamics in the campaign, it is unlikely to erode the Republican stronghold in Ohio's 6th district significantly. Therefore, considering historical voting patterns, party strength, and the nature of special elections, the probability that the Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district is very high.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Both Will Hurd and Vivek Ramaswamy are selected as the Republican nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) The Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Both Will Hurd and Vivek Ramaswamy are selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the selection of the delegates of the Republican National Convention. (2) Credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district, previously held by Bill Johnson. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

metadata.chain_of_thought: In the context of the U.S. Presidential Election, a political party can nominate only one individual as its presidential candidate. Therefore, it is highly unlikely that both Will Hurd and Vivek Ramaswamy will be selected as the Republican nominees for the 2024 election. Since the question requires both conditions to be met for a "Yes" resolution, the probability is extremely low.

question.title: Will the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?
question.body: Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of my knowledge cutoff in October 2023, Kimberly Cheatle is serving as the Director of the U.S. Secret Service. Leadership positions within federal agencies such as the Secret Service typically exhibit stability unless influenced by significant political changes, personal decisions, or unforeseen circumstances. There have been no public reports or indications suggesting that Director Cheatle plans to resign, be dismissed, or leave her position in the foreseeable future. Additionally, the Secret Service operates under the Department of Homeland Security, and high-level appointments like hers generally remain stable barring any substantial reasons for change. Given the lack of information pointing toward an imminent departure, it is unlikely that Kimberly Cheatle will resign or otherwise leave her role before October 12, 2024.

question.title: Conditional on the head of the Secret Service resigning, will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is fired, or for any other reason no longer holds the position before October 12, 2024. 

Then, will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?

Every month, a Manifold poll is posted to gather consensus on the progress towards AGI, asking simply "has weak AGI been achieved," without defining the term. Respondents vote based on their understanding. The July 2024 poll will resolve to YES if the ratio of YES/(NO + YES) is greater than or equal to 0.3, ignoring "no opinion" responses. Otherwise, it resolves to NO.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To estimate the probability that at least 30% of Manifold respondents believe weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024, given the condition that the head of the Secret Service resigns before October 12, 2024, we must consider several factors. As of the knowledge cutoff in October 2023, there is no public indication linking the Secret Service leadership to developments in AGI. The resignation of a high-ranking official like the Director of the Secret Service could influence public perception, but without specific events connecting this resignation to AGI advancements, the correlation appears weak. Additionally, the definition of 'weak AGI' is vague, which may lead to varied interpretations among respondents, potentially diluting the percentage of affirmative responses. Given the conservative nature of public opinion on AGI developments and the lack of direct evidence tying the Secret Service leadership change to AGI progress, it is unlikely that 30% or more of respondents would agree that weak AGI had been achieved by the specified date.

question.title: Given Kimberly Cheatle is no longer the director of the U.S. Secret Service before October 12, 2024, and at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree weak AGI was achieved before July 23, 2024, will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both (a) Kimberly Cheatle will no longer be the director of the U.S. Secret Service before October 12, 2024, and (b) at least 30% of Manifold respondents will agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024. 

(a) This means Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, will have resigned, been fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024.

(b) The July 2024 poll on Manifold will result in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3, indicating that at least 30% of respondents agree weak AGI was achieved, ignoring "no opinion" respondents.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as YES if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

metadata.chain_of_thought:

question.title: Will USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:

The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

question.title: Conditional on the BSE SENSEX closing between 76k and 77k on July 21, 2024, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?

2. The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The invocation of Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to declare a sitting U.S. President incapacitated is an extraordinarily rare and significant action, typically reserved for situations where the President is unable to perform their duties due to severe health issues or other substantial impairments. As of my knowledge cutoff in October 2023, there has been no credible indication or substantial political movement suggesting that Vice President Kamala Harris and a majority of the Cabinet intend to pursue such an action against President Joe Biden. Additionally, the performance of the BSE SENSEX, an Indian stock market index, is unlikely to have a direct causal relationship with U.S. constitutional processes regarding presidential incapacity. While financial markets can reflect and influence broader economic sentiments, there is no established mechanism linking the specific closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, to the invocation of the 25th Amendment in the U.S. political context. Therefore, given the absence of any significant factors that would likely lead to such an unprecedented political move, the probability of President Biden being declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, contingent on the BSE SENSEX closing between 76k and 77k, is exceedingly low.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

(c) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

metadata.chain_of_thought: Reasoning: (a) Predicting the exact closing value of the BSE SENSEX on a specific future date is highly uncertain due to the inherent volatility of stock markets, influenced by a myriad of unpredictable economic, political, and global factors.
